intro: Otopappus simplex, commonly known as the simple pappus plant, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has a low, spreading growth habit. Its leaves are usually linear and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellow. Otopappus simplex is known for its ability to thrive in arid conditions, making it an important species in xerophytic ecosystems.
